definitions: ability to move quickly and easily in different directions or positions
quality of being adaptable in strategic planning or decision-making situations
examples: The fighter jet's superior maneuverability gave it an advantage in combat
Small boats have better maneuverability than large ships in narrow channels
The company's financial maneuverability allowed it to survive the crisis
Political maneuverability requires understanding complex relationships between different groups

definitions: style of Japanese comic books and graphic novels typically with black and white artwork
examples: She collects vintage manga from the 1980s and 1990s
The manga industry generates billions of dollars annually in Japan
Popular manga series often become animated television shows
He learned to read Japanese by studying manga translations

definitions: hard brittle grayish-white metallic element used in steel production and batteries
examples: Manganese is essential for producing high-quality steel alloys
The battery contains manganese dioxide as a key component
Deep-sea nodules contain significant deposits of manganese ore
Manganese deficiency in soil affects plant growth and development

definitions: long open container from which horses or cattle eat hay or grain
examples: The horses gathered around the manger at feeding time
They filled the manger with fresh hay every morning
The nativity scene depicted baby Jesus lying in a manger
Wooden mangers need regular cleaning to prevent mold growth

definitions: sweet fleshy stone fruit with yellow-orange flesh and smooth skin
tropical evergreen tree that produces mango fruits native to South Asia
examples: The ripe mango had a sweet fragrance and golden color
She made mango salsa to serve with grilled fish
The mango tree can grow up to forty meters tall
Ancient mango trees still produce fruit after hundreds of years

definitions: tropical tree or shrub that grows in coastal saline water with exposed roots
tidal swamp ecosystem dominated by mangrove trees supporting diverse marine life
examples: Red mangrove trees have distinctive prop roots extending into the water
Mangrove roots filter pollutants from coastal waters naturally
The mangrove forest provides nursery habitat for many fish species
Coastal mangrove ecosystems protect shorelines from erosion and storms

definitions: island borough of New York City containing the city's economic center
alcoholic cocktail made with whiskey, sweet vermouth, and bitters
examples: Manhattan real estate prices are among the highest in the world
The subway connects Manhattan to the other New York boroughs
He ordered a Manhattan with rye whiskey at the bar
The classic Manhattan cocktail originated in the nineteenth century

definitions: covered opening in a street or sidewalk allowing access to underground utilities
examples: Workers lifted the manhole cover to inspect the sewer system
Steam rose from the manhole on the cold winter morning
The city replaced old manhole covers with theft-resistant designs
Utility crews mark manholes before beginning underground work

definitions: state or period of being an adult male human being
qualities traditionally associated with men such as courage and strength
examples: His transition to manhood began when he left for college
Different cultures have unique ceremonies marking the passage to manhood
He questioned traditional notions of manhood in modern society
True manhood involves responsibility and emotional maturity

definitions: intensive organized search for a person, especially a criminal fugitive
examples: Police launched a massive manhunt after the prison escape
The manhunt involved hundreds of officers across three states
The international manhunt lasted for several months
Television news covered the manhunt with continuous updates

definitions: psychological disorder characterized by extreme excitement, delusions, and overactivity
intense enthusiasm or obsession for something shared by many people
examples: The patient experienced episodes of mania alternating with depression
During mania, individuals may have decreased need for sleep
Tulip mania in Holland created the first recorded speculative bubble
The city was gripped by baseball mania during the playoffs

definitions: person exhibiting extreme symptoms of wild behavior or mental illness
person with excessive enthusiasm or obsession for a particular activity
examples: The movie portrayed him as a dangerous maniac
Police described the attacker as a maniac with no clear motive
She's a fitness maniac who exercises twice every day
My brother is a maniac about keeping his car perfectly clean

definitions: document listing cargo, passengers, or crew on a ship or aircraft
official record of passengers boarding a commercial transportation vehicle
examples: The ship's manifest showed five hundred tons of cargo
Customs officials carefully reviewed the cargo manifest
Her name appeared on the flight manifest from yesterday
The train manifest helped investigators identify all passengers

definitions: outward sign or display showing the existence or presence of something abstract
public gathering or demonstration expressing collective views or feelings
examples: The rash was a manifestation of an allergic reaction
These symptoms are manifestations of underlying stress
The peaceful manifestation attracted thousands of participants
Public manifestations require permits from local authorities

definitions: written public declaration of principles, beliefs, or intentions by a group or individual
examples: The political party published its election manifesto last week
The artist's manifesto explained her radical new approach
The revolutionary manifesto called for complete social transformation
Tech companies often release manifestos outlining their vision

definitions: branched pipe fitting connecting multiple inputs or outputs in engines or plumbing
mathematical space that locally resembles Euclidean space near each point
examples: The exhaust manifold cracked from excessive heat exposure
He replaced the intake manifold to improve engine performance
Differential equations on manifolds require advanced mathematical techniques
The professor explained how a sphere is a two-dimensional manifold

definitions: strong brown paper originally made from Manila hemp fibers
type of rope made from abaca plant fibers native to Philippines
examples: She stored documents in manila folders for filing
The manila envelope contained confidential information
Manila rope resists saltwater damage better than synthetic alternatives
Sailors traditionally preferred manila rope for its durability

definitions: horseshoe-shaped metal bracelet historically used as currency in West Africa
examples: Museums display ancient manilla bracelets from Nigerian trade routes
Portuguese traders used manilla as currency for slaves
Bronze manilla pieces were standard currency before colonial times
Archaeologists discovered a cache of manilla in the excavation

definitions: tropical plant with starchy tuberous roots used as food, also called cassava
examples: Manioc flour forms the basis of many Brazilian dishes
Farmers harvest manioc roots after eight to twelve months
Tapioca pearls are made from processed manioc starch
Manioc provides food security in tropical developing countries

definitions: skillful handling or control of objects, tools, or physical systems
unfair control or influence over someone through deceptive or abusive tactics
examples: Genetic manipulation has revolutionized modern agriculture
The surgeon's precise manipulation of instruments saved the patient
Emotional manipulation damaged their relationship beyond repair
The investigation revealed market manipulation by several traders

definitions: mechanical device or robotic arm designed to handle objects remotely
person who controls or influences others unfairly for personal gain
examples: The robotic manipulator assembled tiny electronic components
Underwater manipulators allow exploration of deep ocean trenches
She recognized him as a manipulator who exploited people's trust
Skilled manipulators often appear charming and helpful initially

definitions: the human race collectively, including all people throughout history
all human beings considered collectively, emphasizing common humanity
examples: Space exploration represents mankind's greatest technological achievement
Climate change poses an existential threat to mankind
The invention of writing transformed mankind forever
Mankind has inhabited Earth for hundreds of thousands of years

definitions: food miraculously supplied to Israelites in the wilderness according to the Bible
unexpected benefit or advantage that appears at the perfect time
examples: According to Exodus, manna appeared each morning except on Sabbath
The Israelites survived on manna during forty years in the desert
The grant money was like manna from heaven for the struggling nonprofit
Unexpected refund checks were manna to cash-strapped students

definitions: life-sized model of human body used to display clothes in stores
person employed to display clothes by wearing them, especially in fashion shows
examples: Store workers dressed the mannequins in the latest spring collection
The mannequin's pose highlighted the dress's flowing design
Professional mannequins practiced their runway walks backstage
She worked as a mannequin before becoming a photographer

definitions: particular way or method of doing something or happening
person's outward bearing or way of behaving toward others
polite or well-bred social behavior according to accepted standards
examples: She explained the procedure in a clear and systematic manner
The crime was committed in a particularly brutal manner
His confident manner impressed the interview panel
The doctor's gentle manner helped calm nervous patients
Children should learn proper table manners from an early age
Good manners cost nothing but mean everything

definitions: distinctive habitual gesture or way of speaking or behaving
sixteenth-century European art style characterized by elongation and artificiality
examples: His mannerism of adjusting his glasses when nervous was endearing
The actor studied the character's mannerisms carefully
Mannerism emerged in Italy after the High Renaissance period
El Greco's paintings exemplify the Mannerism artistic style

definitions: ability to move or be moved easily and smoothly in different directions
examples: The sports car's excellent manoeuvrability made city driving enjoyable
Fighter pilots value manoeuvrability over pure speed
The wheelchair's manoeuvrability allowed navigation through tight spaces
Ship manoeuvrability decreases significantly in shallow water

definitions: carefully planned or controlled movement, especially of vehicles or troops
large-scale military training exercise simulating combat operations
clever or skillful action to achieve a goal or avoid difficulty
examples: The parking manoeuvre required several attempts in the tight space
Ships performed complex manoeuvres to avoid collision
Naval manoeuvres in the Pacific involved twenty thousand personnel
Annual military manoeuvres test readiness and coordination
Her political manoeuvre secured support from key stakeholders
The company's legal manoeuvre avoided significant penalties

definitions: large country house with lands belonging to wealthy landowner
territorial unit of feudal lordship consisting of lord's demesne and tenant holdings
examples: The Victorian manor had been converted into a luxury hotel
They inherited a manor with extensive gardens and farmland
Medieval manor records provide insights into peasant life
The lord of the manor held court for local disputes

definitions: number of workers available or required for a job or task
examples: The construction project requires significant manpower to meet deadlines
Companies struggle to find skilled manpower in competitive markets
Military manpower decreased after the peace treaty
Automation reduces the manpower needed for manufacturing

definitions: house provided for a minister of certain Christian churches, especially Presbyterian
examples: The old manse beside the church needed extensive repairs
Ministers traditionally lived in the manse with their families
The historic manse now serves as a community meeting space
They converted the vacant manse into affordable housing

definitions: male servant, especially one who serves as personal attendant to a gentleman
examples: The elderly gentleman employed a manservant for daily assistance
Victorian households often had multiple manservants
The manservant announced visitors and served dinner
His loyal manservant had worked for the family for decades

definitions: very large impressive house belonging to wealthy person
examples: The tech billionaire's mansion overlooked the Pacific Ocean
Historic mansions line the avenue in the old quarter
They toured the governor's mansion during the open house
The abandoned mansion had thirty rooms and ten bathrooms

definitions: crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought or premeditation
examples: The jury convicted him of involuntary manslaughter, not murder
Vehicular manslaughter charges followed the drunk driving accident
The prosecutor reduced charges from murder to voluntary manslaughter
Manslaughter carries lighter sentences than first-degree murder

definitions: large ray fish with triangular pectoral fins and forward-pointing mouth
type of cloak or blanket worn in Spanish and Latin American countries
examples: The manta ray glided gracefully through the coral reef
Divers swam alongside giant manta rays in the Maldives
She wrapped herself in a colorful manta against the cold
Traditional manta designs reflect indigenous cultural patterns

definitions: ornamental structure around and above a fireplace, including the shelf
examples: Family photographs decorated the marble mantel
They hung Christmas stockings from the mantel
The original Victorian mantel featured intricate carved details
She placed candles along the mantel for ambiance

definitions: light lace or silk scarf worn over head and shoulders by Spanish women
examples: She wore a black mantilla to the traditional Spanish wedding
The mantilla draped elegantly over her ornate hair comb
Antique mantillas are displayed in the textile museum
Brides sometimes choose mantillas instead of traditional veils

definitions: layer of hot rock between Earth's crust and core
loose sleeveless cloak or shawl worn especially by women
important role or responsibility that passes from one person to another
examples: The Earth's mantle makes up most of the planet's volume
Convection currents in the mantle drive plate tectonics
She wore a velvet mantle over her evening gown
Medieval nobles displayed heraldic symbols on their mantles
He accepted the mantle of leadership after his father retired
The young scientist took up the mantle of her mentor's research

definitions: word or sound repeated in meditation or prayer in Hinduism and Buddhism
statement or slogan repeated frequently to reinforce an idea or belief
examples: The meditation teacher gave each student a personal mantra
Om is perhaps the most widely known Sanskrit mantra
Her business mantra was quality over quantity
The team's mantra of continuous improvement drove innovation

definitions: book giving instructions or information about operation or use
vehicle transmission system requiring driver to change gears by hand
examples: The software manual explained all the program features
She consulted the manual before assembling the furniture
He prefers driving manual transmission cars for better control
Learning to drive manual takes practice with the clutch

definitions: historical term for a building or place where goods are manufactured
examples: The old textile manufactory employed hundreds of workers
Steam power transformed manufactories in the industrial revolution
The gun manufactory produced weapons for the continental army
Abandoned manufactories dot the New England landscape

definitions: process of making goods or products in factories using machinery
invented or fabricated information presented as truth
examples: The manufacture of semiconductors requires clean room facilities
Automobile manufacture shifted to robotic assembly lines
The witness admitted to manufacture of false evidence
Media critics accused them of news manufacture

definitions: company or person that makes goods in large quantities using machinery
examples: The car manufacturer recalled thousands of vehicles
Local manufacturers struggle to compete with imports
Pharmaceutical manufacturers invest billions in drug development
The manufacturer's warranty covers defects for two years

definitions: business or process of producing goods in factories on large scale
examples: Manufacturing jobs have declined in developed countries
Advanced manufacturing uses artificial intelligence and robotics
The city's manufacturing sector employs twenty thousand workers
Lean manufacturing principles reduce waste and improve efficiency

definitions: animal dung used for fertilizing land to improve soil quality
examples: Farmers spread manure on fields before spring planting
Composted manure provides essential nutrients for vegetables
Horse manure makes excellent garden fertilizer when aged
The smell of fresh manure filled the barnyard

definitions: handwritten or typed document, especially author's original version before publication
ancient text written by hand before the invention of printing
examples: The author submitted her manuscript to several publishers
Editors reviewed the manuscript for grammatical errors
Medieval manuscripts were illuminated with gold leaf decorations
The ancient manuscript revealed unknown historical details

definitions: visual representation of an area showing physical features, roads, and landmarks
diagram showing the arrangement or sequence of genes on a chromosome
examples: The hiking map showed all trails and elevation changes
GPS navigation has largely replaced paper maps
Scientists completed the genetic map of the human genome
The chromosome map identified disease-causing mutations

definitions: deciduous tree with distinctive lobed leaves that produces sweet sap
hard close-grained wood from maple trees used in furniture and flooring
examples: The sugar maple turns brilliant orange in autumn
Canada's flag features a red maple leaf
Maple flooring adds warmth and durability to homes
The violin's back was crafted from figured maple

definitions: person who creates maps or charts of geographical areas
software tool or component that transforms data between different formats
examples: The mapper surveyed the unexplored territory for months
Digital mappers use satellite imagery and GPS data
The database mapper converts SQL results to objects
Configure the data mapper to handle JSON formatting

definitions: process of creating maps or charts representing geographical features
process of establishing correspondence between elements of different sets or systems
examples: Satellite mapping revolutionized our understanding of Earth's surface
The mapping expedition took three years to complete
Database mapping connects fields to object properties
Gene mapping helps identify inherited disease markers
